executive_summary: The Pet Food Production industry has fared with fluctuating trends. A boost in pet ownership has coincided with a growing tendency to treat pets as family members, thereby encouraging the purchase of higher-priced, premium pet food products that are marketed with special benefits, formulas or ingredients.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The pandemic provides a boost to pet ownership rates
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Decreased household sizes over recent decades have resulted in more disposable income, space and time, creating favorable conditions for increased expenditure on pet care. American consumers have increased ownership of dogs and cats in recent years, with an estimated 66% of domestic households owning pets, according to the 2023-2024 American Pet Products Association (APPA) National Pet Owners Survey.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Economic uncertainty incentivizes pet ownership as part of the family
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising student debt and increasing inflation pressures cause younger adults to delay parenthood, opting for pet ownership as a financially viable alternative.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pet parents often purchase a greater range of high-value pet foods
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pet parents often purchase a greater range of high-value pet foods, like those containing all-natural or organic ingredients, which profit more than traditional pet foods.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The largest pet-owner group is millennials
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In light of income growth, many millennials can afford to move out and live independently. Also, steady income streams enable pet parents to spend more confidently on their pets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: As Generation Z enters adulthood, this group also expands its pet ownership
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Individuals getting married later in their lives are also getting pets in the interim, making younger people a key market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: As commodity prices hike, so do pet food prices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Adverse weather conditions have severely disrupted standard prices for corn, soybeans and oilseeds, all playing important roles as input costs for pet food production. Volatility has meant that input prices rose to unprecedented levels, while COVID-19 exacerbated supply chain challenges, precipitating additional volatility in costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increasing disposable income will bolster industry growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Cat and dog adoptions will increase as demand continues to rise. Consumers are continuing to get married later and later in their lives. Those who aren't married often seek companionship in the form of pets in the interim.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: As consumer disposable income increases, pet owners prioritize their pet's health and nutrition
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumer disposable income increases, pet owners prioritize their pet's health and nutrition by opting for higher quality, premium, organic pet food products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: However, as the Federal Reserve continues to hike interest rates, consumers may look for more affordable pet food alternatives
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: However, as the Federal Reserve continues to hike interest rates, consumers may look for more affordable pet food alternatives to safeguard their budget.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Globalization will heighten demand for domestic pet foods over competitive imported substitutes
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New product innovations will draw attention from overseas.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The buyer mix will continue to shift
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Pet Food Production industry primarily depends on traditional pet stores for sales. Despite changes in retail, these stores will continue to drive the industry's downstream demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Given the evolving customer needs, competition will intensify
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With a highly competitive market, new entrants must take advantage of innovative product lines and niche markets to establish themselves among top producers.

industry_definition: This industry primarily manufactures dog and cat food. Common ingredients include grains, oilseed mill products and meat products. This industry concentrates on dry and semi-moist dog and cat foods in cans or packaged otherwise. Feed for farm livestock is not included.

strengths: Natural products, especially pet food, are expected to gain more popularity as owners increasingly emphasize their pets' diets to improve pet health.

key_trends: The COVID-19 pandemic caused a surge in pet ownership.
Pet parents have splurged on premium products.
Industry associations play an essential role.
Pet stores remain in favor among pet parents.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Mass merchandisers can use their massive purchasing power to deliver discounts on everyday consumer goods.
The e-commerce segment includes online-only retailers specializing in selling pet food and products.
Pet stores provide essential items like food and treats.
Supermarkets and convenience stores provide easy access to buying pet food.
Other markets include veterinary clinics stocked with pet care essentials.

products_and_services.product_description: Kibbles, or dry dog food, is favored among pet owners because of its cost-effectiveness.
Cat food products are generally similar to dog food.
Other products include treats that range from biscuits to various mixtures of meat and grain.

tier_1_suppliers: Pet Food Production in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wheat, Barley & Sorghum Farming in the US
Meat, Beef & Poultry Processing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Pet Grooming & Boarding in the US
tier_2_buyers: E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Mass merchandisers continually lead in retail sales
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Mass merchandisers offer a wide array of products at competitive prices.
The e-commerce segment includes online-only retailers specializing in selling pet food and products.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Pet stores see their position slip
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Pet stores cater to a variety of pet needs.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Supermarkets and convenience stores hit hard by changing trends
demand_determinants.determinant_description: These outlets provided easy access to buying pet food.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The other segment is experiencing a drop
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This market includes veterinary clinics and larger pet-related providers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Import spikes following lower labor costs in foreign countries
international_trade_points.trade_description: There is a significant boost in pet food export figures from Asian countries.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importers benefit from a rising US dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: The strengthening of the US dollar has positively impacted the domestic affordability of imported pet food products.
The industry primarily exports to Canada and Mexico.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports contribute more to the industry than ever before
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports are hampered by the strength of the US dollar.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region boasts numerous food processing facilities.
The Southeast serves as a production hub.
The West region serves as a gateway for upstream food inputs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA imposes strict rules on labeling and advertising.
The EPA regulates waste management in food processing.
The USDA enforces stringent standards for food quality.

regulations_points.regulation_title: ASSOCIATION OF AMERICAN FEED CONTROL OFFICIALS (AAFCO)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The AAFCO develops pet food standards.
Health and safety guidelines were established during the pandemic.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low but increasing.
Competition level is high and increasing.

factors_increased_barrier: Competition level is high and increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: Innovation is key to commercial success.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Large pet food producers influence consumer decisions.
Consolidation has grown as major companies invest in pet food brands.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High profit creates opportunities for smaller companies
concentration_points.concentration_description: Consumers are willing to spend on premium pet foods.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases have decreased over the past five years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profitability Has Seesawed Throughout The Covid-19 Pandemic
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit has decreased over the past five years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages have risen as niche opportunities have induced new companies
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages have increased due to labor shortages.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry's profits have dipped slightly due to rising interest rates.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: As manufacturers transfer increased costs to consumers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry relies on labor to operate machinery.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Larger producers invest in labor-saving machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Limited entry points for new operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: MORE MONEY IN PET OWNERS' POCKETS INCREASES REVENUE
volatility_points.volatility_description: Strong economic conditions have stimulated demand.

volatility_points.volatility_title: CHANGES IN COMMODITY VALUES SHIFT REVENUE
volatility_points.volatility_description: Rising costs of agricultural inputs increase revenue.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DOG FOOD IS THE INDUSTRY'S BEST FRIEND
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Cost-effective kibble is favored among pet owners.
Dry cat food is similar to dog food in characteristics.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Other Segments Also Contribute to Industry Revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Includes treats which are popular among pet owners.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: In response to rising competition, some companies have specialized in premium products.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Macroeconomic conditions influence demand for industry products.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Companies have opted to increasingly automate production.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Fluctuations in input prices impact companies' profit margins.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Investing in equipment has minimized demand for labor.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in technology to establish a competitive edge?
FAQs.answer: Many operators are implementing capital and equipment for value-added products.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The Pet Food Institute provides public education and policy lobbying.

FAQs.question: How have regulations impacted your ability to manufacture your products?
FAQs.answer: FDA regulations require sanitary conditions and truthful labels.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Companies face high pressure to lower prices, but premium product demand boosts revenue.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Typical companies spend significantly on capital equipment.
